headline: Absolutely Fabulous Greek/House Dressing
description: The best Greek salad dressing that livens up any dish and is easy to make and store. A secret restaurant recipe that has everyone wanting more.

video.description: This tangy dressing travels well since it doesn't need refrigeration.
video.name: Absolutely Fabulous Greek Dressing

name: Absolutely Fabulous Greek/House Dressing

recipeInstructions.text: Mix olive oil, garlic powder, oregano, basil, pepper, salt, onion powder, and Dijon-style mustard together in a very large container. Pour in vinegar slowly while mixing vigorously until well blended. Store tightly covered at room temperature.

review.reviewBody: I love everything about this salad dressing!

Scaled it way down. I don't need an almost gallon. Added the juice and zest of 1 lemon (to my quart sized batch). Will try orange zest when I make it again. I have used some of it to marinate lamb ('arm chops') excellent on the grill!
This is one of only 2 salad dressings I ever use anymore. Both homemade. It IS absolutely fabulous!
Fantastic! I even use it as a marinade.
This is a wonderful dressing, easy to make and adjust for smaller quantities. I like to add a little balsamic vinegar to it.
Absolutely delicious
Divided recipe by 6 and it made a lovely pint of dressing. Fantastic!! Added a bit of honey simply because we like honey and not because it needed it. Will make again.
This is from a pizza place that I have been going to for many years. Their salad has tons of feta, beets and slivered red onions that really balance the flavors. The pizza can't be beat as well!

Delicious dressing, an absolute keeper! I've made this dressing many times now and received compliments on it. The only modification I make is to use the same amount of olive oil and red wine vinegar. I find that using more vinegar than oil like the original recipe calls for gives a dressing that is too sour for my taste.
Just like the local restaurant's whose Greek Salads we love. Thanks!
Easy to make and had a great flavor.

I love this salad dressing. I found it on another site and was able to adjust it down to 15 or 30 servings - I forgot which fit into my mason jar. Easy to shake up and love that it does not need to go into the refrigerator. Put it in my lunch box or my travel snack box.
Great! Even my southern husband loved it.
Absolutely delicious! I make a salad from white beans, tomato, shredded cabbage, sliced onion, fresh oregano, feta cheese and this dressing. Wonderful probably on anything!

This dressing is my go-to for when I make a greek orzo salad or a greek lentil salad. Delicious! I wouldn't change a thing. Tonight I had started making a batch scaled down for 10 and only had 1/2 cup of red wine vinegar instead of 2/3. I subbed the rest with lemon juice and it was equally delicious.
Excellent Greek Salad recipe

Love this dressing, use it on everything from sandwiches to salads, great on avocado or hummus toast. Only change I make is to scale it down so it fits in a mason jar and add a generous pinch of sugar.
This is a delicious Greek dressing. I also use it as a chicken marinade — my boys love it.

I've been making this dressing for a year or so and my hubby and I both love it. it lasts a long, long time on the kitchen counter and keeps its flavor. I do add extra olive oil because it's a little too tangy for me as written but that's just a personal taste. this is a great recipe. note: I cut the recipe in half since there's only the two of us. this is a great dressing!

Beautiful color and fragrant. I'll have it with chicken breast tonight after it has chilled in the fridge. 

*I used fresh garlic, pressed

Outstanding as is

Use the scaled down version (on phone) to make just the right amount (makes enough to fill salad dressing bottle)
At first I thought it was too tangy. After letting it mellow I realized it was perfect!
This is great dressing. Thanks for sharing. I didn't change a thing.
OMG.....the best
I scaled the recipe down to eight servings and it turned out great. no oddball measurements. The dressing was fabulous!
If it doesn't have lemon juice in it, it's not greek. It a good dressing. Add fresh lemon juice. Then it's greek.
Perfect. Easy. Nothing more to be said.
This dressing is so good!

5-Stars, so this is just extra info:
I don't care for either onion powder or garlic powder, however the flavour mellows out ofter a day and the convenience of having the dressing on the counter and ready to go is a more than fair exchange. I dial the onion and garlic powder back a bit and when ready to actually have the salad I rub a sliced garlic clove or two over the salad bowl. 
I also am a fan of fresh lemon juice in in the dressing, so I dial back the vinegar a tad and when ready to actually have the salad I add a squeeze of fresh lemon to the bowl.
I like experimenting with vinegar and often try to mix it up a bit, though red wine vinegar remains the core.
I confess to being an oregano junkie, and tend to up the quantity.
All said and done, a fabulous and convenient greek dressing exactly as published. The the changes are merely personal tweaks.
I always have this dressing on hand and it's amazing. I used it today and a chickpea and tuna salad and it's amazing. It's basically the only salad dressing I ever use.
Great!

We halved the vinegar and cut the recipe down to suit a pasta salad. We used 
3/4 cup olive oil
2 teaspoons garlic powder
2 teaspoons dried oregano
2 teaspoons dried basil
1 and 1/2 teaspoons pepper
1 and 1/4 teaspoons salt
1 and 1/2 teaspoons onion powder
1 and 1/2 teaspoons Dijon-style mustard
1/2 cup red wine vinegar 
For pasta salad, it works well if you add half of it, mix it together, leave it in fridge at least 1 hour, then add the other half of the dressing when serving. I definitely plan on making this one again! Yum!
The absolute best!

Super easy very tart. Make a lot, it gets better the longer it sits. It tastes just like my local pizzeria. 

I like to add sugar equal to the pepper amount.
This is very good, I am glad it hasn't been kept a secret!
Made this for a quinoa salad and it was amazing!
Loved this so much. Will be making it regularly from now on.
My family loves this dressing! I reduced the serving size to 10 servings and used a 3:1 ratio for the oil and vinegar. Kept all of the other ingredients the same. Delicious!
I made this for the first time and loved it. Easy recipe with easy directions to follow. More salads for me over the next week.

I loved this! Even my very picky husband commented that it was good. I didn't have red wine vinegar so I used 1/4 cup of apple cider vinegar and 2 tbsp of water instead (FYI: I converted the number of servings to 5 so the recipe asked for 1/3 cup of red wine vinegar).
I've had to make this countless times for family and friends who just can't get enough!! Perfect for camping as it doesn't need to be refrigerated.

Love this one! It stands out as an authentic Greek dressing.

I used Angk recipe at bottom of recipe
This was excellent. Wouldn't change a thing!
This was excellent. Wouldn't change a thing!

I made this, but I don’t know that I love it as a salad dressing. It was too tart for my salad. HOWEVER, it is probably THE BEST chicken marinade I’ve ever eaten! Holy cow. Soooo good. So, for that reason, it gets 5 stars from me. I will marinate chicken in it many, many more times. Thank you!
This is my go to. I've used white wine vinegar as well. I don't add as much salt as called for. It's so quick to make and tastes great.

Awesome greek salad dressing! I made it as stated the first time and it was great. 

The only thing I didnt like was that it separated within seconds of shaking and it if you pour out a bit too much your salad is ruined. I put the dressing in one of those store bought salad dressing shakers and it ended up spewing everywhere on the ride home. 
The fix is to definitely emulsify it... throw it in a good blender and chop up all of those seasonings super fine. The mix will stay blended better and not be as leaky.

Also, my hubby hates salty and I thought this may come across way to salty to him, so I left out the salt. The vinegar added enough flavor for both of us to enjoy.

This is a great home made recipe for a greek or Italian style salad dressing. Scale it down to fit your needs but it keeps on the counter in a jar for a long time. We have been using this one as a staple for years

As a Greek and as a Greek Chef my taste buds are pretty much in target. This recipe is just “ok”. Anyone making this should definitely scale down the vinegar to half the written amount. Second, I would cut back my salt to half the written amount. 
Will I make this again ? Probably not unless I tweaked it

I love salads but am on a low sodium diet however it has been hard to find a good recipe for salad dressing. Came across this recipe, made exactly as written and it is now my favorite, I make it frequently.

I just made this dressing and it is absolutely fabulous. I scaled it down to 10 servings so it would fit in a container. I want to comment that I made a few modifications , but nothing drastic.
1- I cut the amount of olive oil in 1/2 and used low fat chicken broth as a substitute for the remaining amount of oil. I did this because I wanted a lower fat version. TIP: You can actually do this for any dressing recipe 
2- After reading a ton of the other reviews stating that the vinegar was too much, I cut the amount of vinegar in 1/2 and used lemon juice as a substitute for the remaining amount
3- I don't believe that Danielle says this in her recipe, but I made it in the blender to make sure that the oil & vinegar blended. 
That was it! The mustard gives this dressing a touch of creaminess but it still remains a vinaigrette and the flavor is amazing.

Delicious! Scaled down and used equal parts oil/vinegar, (balsamic vinegar and spicy brown mustard -what I had). Measurements: 1/2 c oil/vin, 1 tsp + rounded 1/4 tsp of garlic powder, basil, oregano. 1 tsp salt, pepper, onion powder, mustard. All but oil in blender, slowly blend in oil. Store in lidded container that can be spooned out in fridge and it stays emulsified.
